title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Proverbs chapter 19 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Proverbs Chapter 19.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 19:1, who is better than the fool that is perverse in his lips?
options: The poor that walketh in his integrity
The rich man who is generous
The wise man with many friends
The servant who obeys his master
questions.correctAnswer: The poor that walketh in his integrity
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:1 states that it is better to be poor and walk in integrity than to be perverse in speech and a fool.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19:4 say wealth maketh?
questions.correctAnswer: Many friends
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:4 explains that wealth makes many friends, but the poor is separated from his neighbor.

questions.question: What happens to a false witness according to Proverbs 19:5?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall not be unpunished
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:5 warns that a false witness will not go unpunished and that one who speaks lies will not escape.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 19:7 states that all the brethren of the poor love him.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:7 actually says that all the brethren of the poor hate him, and even his friends go far from him.

questions.question: Who is described as a calamity to his father in Proverbs 19:13?
questions.correctAnswer: A foolish son
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:13 calls a foolish son the calamity of his father.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 19:15, what does slothfulness cause?
questions.correctAnswer: A deep sleep
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:15 states that slothfulness casts a man into a deep sleep and an idle soul will suffer hunger.

questions.question: What should a man do while there is hope according to Proverbs 19:18?
questions.correctAnswer: Chasten his son
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:18 advises to chasten thy son while there is hope and not spare for his crying.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the ______.' (Proverbs 19:17)
questions.correctAnswer: LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:17 teaches that he who has pity on the poor lends to the LORD, who will repay him.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 19:11, what is the glory of a man?
questions.correctAnswer: To pass over a transgression
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:11 states that discretion helps a man defer his anger and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 19:23 says that the fear of the LORD tendeth to life and satisfaction.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:23 confirms that the fear of the LORD leads to life and satisfaction, protecting one from evil.

questions.question: What is a prudent wife described as in Proverbs 19:14?
questions.correctAnswer: From the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:14 says that a prudent wife is from the LORD, along with house and riches inherited from fathers.

questions.question: Who is a son that causeth shame and bringeth reproach according to Proverbs 19:26?
options: He that wasteth his father and chaseth away his mother
questions.correctAnswer: He that wasteth his father and chaseth away his mother
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:26 identifies a son who wastes his father and chases away his mother as one causing shame and reproach.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 19:2 teaches that a soul without knowledge is good.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:2 clearly states that a soul without knowledge is not good.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 19:25, what effect does smiting a scorner have?
questions.correctAnswer: The simple will beware
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:25 explains that smiting a scorner causes the simple to beware.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19:21 say will stand despite many devices in a man's heart?
questions.correctAnswer: The counsel of the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:21 teaches that although there are many plans in a man's heart, the counsel of the LORD will stand.

medium.title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Proverbs Chapter 19 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with integrity in speech and actions. Based on Proverbs 19, what biblical truth would you share about integrity?
options: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool
Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep
A foolish son is the calamity of his father
questions.correctAnswer: Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:1 teaches that integrity is more valuable than riches or foolish speech. This is supported by verses 8 (loving wisdom), 16 (keeping commandments), and 29 (judgments for fools), emphasizing the importance of righteous living.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 19 guide us in responding to anger and offense in relationships?
options: The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression
A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment
A foolish son is the calamity of his father
Many will intreat the favour of the prince
questions.correctAnswer: The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:11 encourages patience and forgiveness as a mark of wisdom. Verses 18 (chastening with hope) and 29 (judgments for scorners) also emphasize wise correction and restraint.

questions.question: A fellow believer asks how to gain wisdom and understanding for daily living. What does Proverbs 19 say about this?
options: He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: he that keepeth understanding shall find good
A false witness shall not be unpunished
The king's wrath is as the roaring of a lion
Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep
questions.correctAnswer: He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul: he that keepeth understanding shall find good
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:8 highlights the value of wisdom and understanding for personal well-being. This is consistent with verses 20 (hearing counsel), 27 (ceasing from incorrect instruction), and 23 (fear of the LORD tending to life).

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 19 teaches that a false witness will escape punishment if they are clever.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verses 5 and 9 clearly state that a false witness shall not be unpunished and that liars shall perish. This teaches the certainty of God's justice against dishonesty.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19 say about the relationship between wealth and friendship?
options: Wealth maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour
Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity
He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul
questions.correctAnswer: Wealth maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:4 explains how wealth can attract friends while poverty often results in isolation. This is complemented by verse 7, where even friends and family may distance themselves from the poor.

questions.question: A believer is feeling discouraged by laziness and its consequences. According to Proverbs 19, what teaching would encourage them?
options: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger
The desire of a man is his kindness
The king's wrath is as the roaring of a lion
questions.correctAnswer: Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:15 warns against laziness and its consequences, urging diligence. This is supported by verses 24 (slothful man hideth his hand) and 20 (hear counsel to be wise).

questions.question: How does Proverbs 19 describe the impact of a foolish son on the family?
options: A foolish son is the calamity of his father
The fear of the LORD tendeth to life
He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the LORD
The discretion of a man deferreth his anger
questions.correctAnswer: A foolish son is the calamity of his father
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:13 describes how a foolish child brings trouble to his father, highlighting the importance of wise parenting. Verse 18 also advises timely correction of sons while there is hope.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 19 teaches that the fear of the LORD leads to satisfaction and protection from evil.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:23 states that the fear of the LORD tends to life and satisfaction, and those who have it will not be visited with evil, affirming trust in God’s protection.

questions.question: What counsel does Proverbs 19 give about instruction and receiving wisdom?
options: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end
A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment
House and riches are the inheritance of fathers
The desire of a man is his kindness
questions.correctAnswer: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that thou mayest be wise in thy latter end
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:20 encourages being open to counsel and instruction for gaining wisdom. This is complemented by verse 27, which warns against listening to misleading instruction.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 19, what is a prudent wife considered to be?
options: A prudent wife is from the LORD
A foolish son is the calamity of his father
A false witness shall not be unpunished
The discretion of a man deferreth his anger
questions.correctAnswer: A prudent wife is from the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:14 teaches that a prudent wife is a blessing and gift from God, emphasizing the value of godly partnership in marriage.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the _____; and that which he hath given will he pay him again."
questions.correctAnswer: LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:17 teaches that showing mercy to the poor is as if lending to the LORD Himself, who will repay the giver, underscoring generosity and stewardship.

questions.question: What warning does Proverbs 19 give concerning the anger of a man who is quick to wrath?
options: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment; for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again
The discretion of a man deferreth his anger
The fear of the LORD tendeth to life
questions.correctAnswer: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment; for if thou deliver him, yet thou must do it again
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:19 warns that a person with a quick temper will face repeated consequences, encouraging self-control as supported by verse 11.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 19 describe the king’s anger and favor?
options: The king's wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass
A foolish son is the calamity of his father
He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul
questions.correctAnswer: The king's wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:12 contrasts the severity of a king’s anger with the refreshing nature of his favor, illustrating the power of authority and grace.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19 say about the consequences for scorners and fools?
options: Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of fools
He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul
Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep
Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity
questions.correctAnswer: Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of fools
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:29 states that there are consequences for mockers and fools, reinforcing the call for humility and wisdom as in verses 11 and 20.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to speak falsely or bear false witness. What warning does Proverbs 19 give about this behavior?
options: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall perish
He that getteth wisdom loveth his own soul
The discretion of a man deferreth his anger
The desire of a man is his kindness
questions.correctAnswer: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall perish
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:9 warns that false testimony and lying will bring punishment, underscoring the importance of honesty as shown also in verses 5 and 28.

hard.title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Proverbs Chapter 19.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 19:1, who is considered better than a perverse fool?
options: The poor who walk in integrity
questions.correctAnswer: The poor who walk in integrity
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:1 states that 'Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool,' highlighting the value of integrity over foolishness.

questions.question: What consequence is linked with haste in Proverbs 19:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Sinning with one's feet
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:2 warns that he who hasteth with his feet sinneth, emphasizing the negative outcomes of acting without knowledge.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19:3 say about the relationship between a man's foolishness and his heart's attitude toward the LORD?
options: Foolishness perverts his way and his heart frets against the LORD
Foolishness leads to humility before the LORD
Foolishness strengthens his faith in the LORD
Foolishness causes his heart to rejoice in the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Foolishness perverts his way and his heart frets against the LORD
questions.explanation: This verse explains that foolishness leads to a perverted path and a heart that is troubled or resents the LORD.

questions.question: Proverbs 19:4 contrasts wealth and poverty in relation to friendship. What does it say?
options: Wealth maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour
Wealth isolates a man; poverty brings many friends
Both wealth and poverty make many friends
Neither wealth nor poverty affects friendship
questions.correctAnswer: Wealth maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour
questions.explanation: This verse highlights the social reality in the ancient Near East where wealth often attracted friends, whereas poverty caused separation.

questions.question: Which phrase best captures the repeated consequence for a false witness as found in Proverbs 19:5 and Proverbs 19:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Shall not be unpunished
questions.explanation: Both verses emphasize that false witnesses and liars will face punishment, underpinning the theme of divine justice.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19:6 say about the influence of gifts on social relationships?
options: Everyone is a friend to him that giveth gifts
Gifts have no effect on friendship
questions.correctAnswer: Everyone is a friend to him that giveth gifts
questions.explanation: This reflects the cultural practice in the ancient Near East where gift-giving was important in securing favor and friendships.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 19:8, what is the benefit of obtaining wisdom and keeping understanding?
options: Loving one's soul and finding good
questions.correctAnswer: Loving one's soul and finding good
questions.explanation: The verse connects the pursuit of wisdom with self-care and the discovery of goodness, emphasizing internal growth.

questions.question: Proverbs 19:11 speaks of a man's discretion. What is described as his glory?
questions.correctAnswer: Passing over a transgression
questions.explanation: Discretion is shown by deferring anger and overlooking offenses, which is considered honorable.

questions.question: How is the king's wrath metaphorically described in Proverbs 19:12?
options: As the roaring of a lion
questions.correctAnswer: As the roaring of a lion
questions.explanation: This metaphor indicates the king's anger is powerful and fearsome, consistent with royal authority in the ancient Near East.

questions.question: What inheritance is described in Proverbs 19:14, and what is said about a prudent wife?
options: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers; a prudent wife is from the LORD
Only wealth is inherited; wives are chosen by men
Inheritance is only spiritual; wives come from family
No inheritance is mentioned; a prudent wife is from neighbors
questions.correctAnswer: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers; a prudent wife is from the LORD
questions.explanation: This verse emphasizes material inheritance and the divine origin of a wise wife, reflecting cultural values and theological belief.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19:15 identify as the result of slothfulness?
questions.correctAnswer: Deep sleep and hunger
questions.explanation: Slothfulness leads to physical inactivity symbolized by deep sleep and results in lack, reflecting a moral cause and effect.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 19:17, lending to the poor is equated with lending to whom?
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD
questions.explanation: This reflects the theological principle that caring for the poor honors God, promising repayment from Him.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 19:20 encourages hearing counsel and receiving instruction to gain wisdom in the latter part of life.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The verse advocates for openness to advice and learning to ensure wisdom, especially in one’s later years.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19:21 teach about the plans of a man versus the counsel of the LORD?
options: Many devices in a man's heart exist, but the LORD's counsel shall stand
Man's plans are always superior to the LORD's counsel
The LORD follows the devices of man's heart
Man's devices always fail and the LORD ignores them
questions.correctAnswer: Many devices in a man's heart exist, but the LORD's counsel shall stand
questions.explanation: This highlights divine sovereignty over human intentions, a key theological theme consistent throughout Scripture.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'The fear of the LORD tendeth to _______, and he that hath it shall abide satisfied.'
questions.correctAnswer: life
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:23 connects the fear of the LORD with life and satisfaction, emphasizing spiritual vitality.

theological.title: Proverbs Chapter 19 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Proverbs Chapter 19 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 19:1, what is considered better than being perverse in lips and foolish?
options: The poor who walk in integrity
questions.correctAnswer: The poor who walk in integrity
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:1 states that 'Better is the poor that walketh in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.' This highlights the biblical theme that integrity and righteousness are more valuable than wealth or eloquence. Similar themes are found in Psalm 15:2-3, James 1:22, Matthew 5:8, and Romans 12:9, emphasizing the importance of integrity over outward appearances or speech.

questions.question: What consequence does Proverbs 19:2 associate with a soul that is without knowledge?
options: It is not good and leads to sinning hastily
questions.correctAnswer: It is not good and leads to sinning hastily
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:2 teaches that 'the soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he that hasteth with his feet sinneth.' Lacking knowledge leads to rash actions that result in sin. This principle aligns with Hosea 4:6, Ephesians 4:14, James 1:5, and Proverbs 1:7, which emphasize the importance of knowledge and wisdom to avoid sin.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19:3 say about the folly of man and his relationship with the LORD?
options: Foolishness perverts his way and his heart frets against the LORD
Foolishness leads to great blessings from God
Foolishness is rewarded by the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: Foolishness perverts his way and his heart frets against the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:3 states that 'The foolishness of man perverteth his way: and his heart fretteth against the LORD.' This reveals human pride and rebellion as consequences of folly. This relates to Romans 1:21, Jeremiah 17:9, Isaiah 55:8-9, and Psalm 10:4, showing how folly alienates man from God and distorts his path.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 19:4, what is the effect of wealth on friendships?
options: Wealth makes many friends, but the poor is separated from his neighbor
Wealth isolates a person from everyone
Wealth has no impact on friendships
The poor have more true friends than the wealthy
questions.correctAnswer: Wealth makes many friends, but the poor is separated from his neighbor
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:4 notes 'Wealth maketh many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbour.' This highlights the social effects of wealth and poverty. Similar observations are made in Ecclesiastes 7:12, Luke 16:9, 1 Timothy 6:10, and James 2:5, showing the biblical view on riches and social relationships.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19:5 warn about false witnesses and liars?
options: They shall not be unpunished and shall not escape
They will be honored in their generation
They will receive mercy if they repent
questions.correctAnswer: They shall not be unpunished and shall not escape
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:5 states 'A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaketh lies shall not escape.' This emphasizes divine justice on dishonesty. This principle is echoed in Exodus 20:16, Zechariah 8:16, John 8:44, and Revelation 21:8, affirming the biblical condemnation of falsehood.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19:11 identify as a mark of a man's discretion and glory?
options: Deferreth his anger and passes over a transgression
questions.correctAnswer: Deferreth his anger and passes over a transgression
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:11 says 'The discretion of a man deferreth his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.' This teaches the virtue of patience and forgiveness. Related teachings are found in James 1:19-20, Ephesians 4:26-27, Colossians 3:13, and Matthew 5:44, emphasizing self-control and mercy.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 19:12, how is the king's wrath described and contrasted with his favor?
options: Wrath as roaring of a lion; favor as dew upon the grass
Wrath as fire; favor as sunshine
Wrath as thunder; favor as a river
Wrath as a storm; favor as a gentle breeze
questions.correctAnswer: Wrath as roaring of a lion; favor as dew upon the grass
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:12 compares the king's wrath to the roaring of a lion and his favor to dew upon the grass. This metaphor illustrates the severity of judgment and the grace of favor. Comparable imagery is found in Hosea 11:10, Nahum 1:2, Psalm 68:14, and Isaiah 55:10, underscoring God's justice and mercy.

questions.question: What inheritance is mentioned in Proverbs 19:14, and what is said about a prudent wife?
options: House and riches are from fathers; a prudent wife is from the LORD
Only wealth is inherited; wives are chosen by men
Inheritance is unreliable; prudence comes from education
Inheritance is from God; wives come from chance
questions.correctAnswer: House and riches are from fathers; a prudent wife is from the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:14 teaches that 'House and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the LORD.' This indicates God’s sovereignty in providing a wise spouse. This aligns with Genesis 24:50, Psalm 127:3, Proverbs 31:10, and Ephesians 5:22-33, affirming God's role in family blessings.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19:15 warn about slothfulness and idleness?
options: Slothfulness causes deep sleep and hunger
Slothfulness leads to wealth and honor
Slothfulness is a sign of spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: Slothfulness causes deep sleep and hunger
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:15 states 'Slothfulness casteth into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.' This reveals the destructive consequences of laziness. Similar warnings appear in Ecclesiastes 10:18, 2 Thessalonians 3:10, Proverbs 6:6-11, and Colossians 3:23, promoting diligence as a godly virtue.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 19:16, what is the outcome of keeping the commandment versus despising God’s ways?
options: Keeping commandment preserves life; despising ways leads to death
Keeping commandment leads to wealth; despising leads to poverty
Keeping commandment brings sorrow; despising brings joy
There is no difference between keeping and despising
questions.correctAnswer: Keeping commandment preserves life; despising ways leads to death
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:16 teaches 'He that keepeth the commandment keepeth his own soul; but he that despiseth his ways shall die.' This reflects the biblical doctrine of obedience linked to life and disobedience to death. This is consistent with Deuteronomy 30:15-20, John 14:15, Romans 6:23, and James 1:25.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19:17 say about showing pity to the poor?
options: He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the LORD; He will pay him again
Showing pity to the poor is a waste of resources
Pity to the poor earns only human praise
Helping the poor causes personal loss
questions.correctAnswer: He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the LORD; He will pay him again
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:17 states 'He that hath pity upon the poor lendeth unto the LORD; and that which he hath given will he pay him again.' This teaches that acts of mercy are regarded as service to God Himself. This theme is echoed in Matthew 25:40, Hebrews 13:16, Luke 6:38, and 1 John 3:17.

questions.question: What instruction does Proverbs 19:18 give about disciplining a son?
options: Chasten thy son while there is hope; do not spare for his crying
Allow the son to learn from his mistakes without correction
Ignore the son’s faults to encourage freedom
Discipline only when the son becomes an adult
questions.correctAnswer: Chasten thy son while there is hope; do not spare for his crying
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:18 counsels 'Chasten thy son while there is hope, and let not thy soul spare for his crying.' This emphasizes timely and loving correction for training in righteousness. Proverbs 22:15, Hebrews 12:5-11, Ephesians 6:4, and Deuteronomy 6:6-7 affirm this principle of godly discipline.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19:20 advise concerning counsel and instruction?
options: Hear counsel and receive instruction to be wise in latter end
Ignore counsel and follow your own heart
Instruction is unnecessary for the wise
questions.correctAnswer: Hear counsel and receive instruction to be wise in latter end
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:20 teaches the importance of accepting guidance for ultimate wisdom. This is consistent with Proverbs 1:5, Psalm 32:8, Colossians 3:16, and James 1:5, showing the value of humility and teachability in Christian growth.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19:21 reveal about human plans compared to the counsel of the LORD?
options: Many devices in man's heart, but the LORD's counsel shall stand
Man's plans always prevail over God's
questions.correctAnswer: Many devices in man's heart, but the LORD's counsel shall stand
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:21 states 'There are many devices in a man's heart; nevertheless the counsel of the LORD, that shall stand.' This teaches God's sovereignty over human plans. Similar truths appear in Isaiah 55:8-11, Jeremiah 29:11, Romans 8:28, and Psalm 33:10-11.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 19:23 describe as the effect of fearing the LORD?
options: It tendeth to life, satisfaction, and freedom from evil
It leads to fear and despair
It results in wealth and power
questions.correctAnswer: It tendeth to life, satisfaction, and freedom from evil
questions.explanation: Proverbs 19:23 teaches that 'The fear of the LORD tendeth to life: and he that hath it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.' This affirms the blessing of reverence for God. This is supported by Psalm 34:9, Proverbs 14:27, Isaiah 33:6, and Ecclesiastes 12:13-14.
